results.title: A New art in cooking
results.creator_credit: Lawry's Food Inc and Jerry Warner
results.brief_description: Every woman, no matter why her culinary talents, can produce unique and exciting cooking masterpieces in her own kitchen through the artistry of seasoning blends/ Employing works of master painters to introduce this concept, the film demonstrates the ease with which readily available seasoning ingredients can be used to add zest and variety to every meal. In addition, imaginative table settings provide new ideas.

results.title: A New approach to dental health
results.brief_description: Shows a multidisciplinary approach to the teaching of dental care in some English schools. Illustrates how reading, writing, mathematical and social skills, as well as knowledge of dental care, can be developed with this approach. Also notes parents’ reactions to this style of teaching.

results.title: A Natural question
results.creator_credit: Stan Gomm and Central Electricity Generating Board Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the liaison between the sponsor and nature conservationists; showing some of the special nature trails they have set up for children in industrialised areas and describing other ways in which they are contributing towards nature conservancy. Presented by Phil Drabble with Art Direction by Richard Piper.

results.title: A Natural history of a psychotic illness in childhood
results.brief_description: Documented case from infancy onward. A chain of accidental circumstances provide a unique opportunity to obtain a visualised record of the gradual unfolding of the psychotic process in childhood. Contains material from three excellent sources, a family album of still photographs that tell the change in a series of static steps, a motion picture, filling in the gap between the stills with greater dynamic effect and a detailed and strangely objective diary kept by the mother. Research directed by James Anthony.

results.title: A Nation transformed 1945-1965
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten, Gerald Renaud, Films Incorporated and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Japan: imperial power to industrial giant”.
From the ashes of total defeat Japan rose in 21 years to an unparalleled economic and social level. The film portrays this remarkable recovery, noting the influences of MacArthur, the fierce national pride of the Japanese, and the new ideas of democracy. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: A Nation of shopkeepers
results.creator_credit: British Productivity Council and World Wide
results.brief_description: Intelligent use of Method Study can help any trader, shopkeeper, distributor or manufacturer. The example of an ironmonger’s shop shows how analysis of work is applied to the retail trade, leading to lower costs, higher turnovers, less waste of time and money, and greater satisfaction to both staff and customers. How to keep the cost of changes of layout and method involved to a minimum.

results.title: A Nation is built
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. His nature portraits became a model for many local filmmakers who tried to emulate his high technical standards and good romantic manner. After filming in many exotic locations, such as Antarctica and Papua New Guinea, Hurley remained in Australia in the 1930’s to become the dominant figure in Australian documentary, making short industrial films for government and private sponsors, such as this film, “A Nation is Built”. Sponsored by the New South Wales government to mark 150 years of white Australian settlement.

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.
